page.title: 05Parish Churches
page.content: {Stapleford.} The Parish Church of St.Mary dates from the middle of 12th.century,though it was extended in the 14th.and 15th.centuries.The belfry in the tower houses five 17th.century bells. {Vicar Rev.J.P.Adams. {Wishford.} The Parish Church of Wishford Magna dates back to 13th.century,though it was largely rebuilt in 1863 by T.H.Wyatt.The tower belfry contains six bells. {Rector Rev.J.Meacham.} {Little Langford.} St.Nicholas Church,originally 12th. century,rebuilt in 1864 by T.H.Wyatt. {Rector Rev.B.Thomas. Roman Catholics in the area are served by churches in Wilton and Salisbury,while the Methodist church lies in nearby Stoford.
